books.title: Introduction to Algorithms
books.author: Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, Clifford Stein
books.description: A comprehensive update of the leading algorithms text, with new material on matchings in bipartite graphs, online algorithms, machine learning, and other topics.
books.series: MIT Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
books.subject: Algorithms

books.title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
books.author: Robert C. Martin
books.description: Even bad code can function. But if code isn't clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees.
books.subject: Software Development

books.title: The Design of Everyday Things
books.author: Don Norman
books.description: A fully updated and expanded edition of Don Norman's classic and influential work, which pioneered the application of cognitive science to design.
books.subject: Product Design

books.title: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach
books.author: Stuart Russell, Peter Norvig
books.description: The most comprehensive, up-to-date introduction to the theory and practice of artificial intelligence.
books.subject: Artificial Intelligence

books.title: Deep Learning
books.author: Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, Aaron Courville
books.description: An introduction to a broad range of topics in deep learning, covering mathematical and conceptual background, deep learning techniques used in industry, and research perspectives.
books.subject: Deep Learning

books.title: Computer Networks
books.author: Andrew S. Tanenbaum, Nick Feamster, David J. Wetherall
books.description: For courses in Networking/Communications. Motivates students with a top-down, layered approach to computer networking. Unique among computer networking texts, the Seventh Edition of the popular Computer Networking: A Top Down Approach builds on the authors long tradition of teaching this complex subject through a layered approach in a top-down manner.
books.subject: Networking

books.title: Database System Concepts
books.author: Abraham Silberschatz, Henry F. Korth, S. Sudarshan
books.description: Database System Concepts presents the fundamental concepts of database management in an intuitive manner geared toward allowing students to begin working with databases as quickly as possible.
books.subject: Database Systems

books.title: Operating System Concepts
books.author: Abraham Silberschatz, Peter B. Galvin, Greg Gagne
books.description: The tenth edition of Operating System Concepts has been revised to keep it fresh and up-to-date with contemporary examples of how operating systems function, as well as enhanced interactive elements to improve learning and the student’s experience with the material.
books.subject: Operating Systems

books.title: Computer Organization and Design
books.author: David A. Patterson, John L. Hennessy
books.description: Computer Organization and Design RISC-V Edition: The Hardware Software Interface, Second Edition, the award-winning textbook from Patterson and Hennessy that is used by more than 40,000 students per year, continues to present the most comprehensive and readable introduction to this core computer science topic.
books.series: The Morgan Kaufmann Series in Computer Architecture and Design
books.subject: Computer Architecture

books.title: The C Programming Language
books.author: Brian W. Kernighan, Dennis M. Ritchie
books.description: Known as the bible of C, this classic bestseller introduces the C programming language and illustrates algorithms, data structures, and programming techniques.
books.subject: Programming Languages

books.title: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
books.author: Harold Abelson, Gerald Jay Sussman, Julie Sussman
books.description: A classic textbook that teaches fundamental principles of computer programming, including abstraction, recursion, and modularity.
books.subject: Programming Principles

books.title: Compilers: Principles, Techniques, and Tools
books.author: Alfred V. Aho, Monica S. Lam, Ravi Sethi, Jeffrey D. Ullman
books.description: The classic Dragon Book on compiler design, covering lexical analysis, parsing, syntax-directed translation, and code optimization.
books.subject: Compiler Design

books.title: Computer Graphics: Principles and Practice
books.author: John F. Hughes, Andries van Dam, Morgan McGuire, David F. Sklar
books.description: A comprehensive introduction to computer graphics that explores the core concepts, mathematical foundations, and modern techniques.
books.subject: Computer Graphics

books.title: Introduction to the Theory of Computation
books.author: Michael Sipser
books.description: Gain a clear understanding of even the most complex, highly theoretical computational theory topics in the approachable presentation found only in the market-leading INTRODUCTION TO THE THEORY OF COMPUTATION, 3E.
books.subject: Theory of Computation

books.title: Computer Security: Principles and Practice
books.author: William Stallings, Lawrie Brown
books.description: Computer Security: Principles and Practice, Fourth Edition, is ideal for courses in Computer/Network Security.
books.subject: Computer Security

books.title: Data Mining: Concepts and Techniques
books.author: Jiawei Han, Micheline Kamber, Jian Pei
books.description: Data Mining: Concepts and Techniques, Fourth Edition introduces concepts, principles, and methods for mining patterns, knowledge, and models from various kinds of data for diverse applications.
books.series: The Morgan Kaufmann Series in Data Management Systems
books.subject: Data Mining

books.title: Distributed Systems: Concepts and Design
books.author: George Coulouris, Jean Dollimore, Tim Kindberg, Gordon Blair
books.description: Distributed Systems provides students of computer science and engineering with the skills they will need to design and maintain software for distributed applications.
books.subject: Distributed Systems

books.title: Computer Vision: Algorithms and Applications
books.author: Richard Szeliski
books.description: Computer Vision: Algorithms and Applications explores the variety of techniques used to analyze and interpret images.
books.subject: Computer Vision

books.title: Software Engineering: A Practitioner's Approach
books.author: Roger S. Pressman, Bruce R. Maxim
books.description: For almost four decades, Software Engineering: A Practitioner's Approach (SEPA) has been the world's leading textbook in software engineering.
books.subject: Software Engineering

books.title: The Mythical Man-Month: Essays on Software Engineering
books.author: Frederick P. Brooks Jr.
books.description: A classic collection of essays on software engineering and project management, including the famous 'No Silver Bullet' essay.
books.subject: Software Project Management

books.title: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
books.author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides
books.description: Capturing a wealth of experience about the design of object-oriented software, four top-notch designers present a catalog of simple and succinct solutions to commonly occurring design problems.
books.subject: Design Patterns

books.title: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
books.author: Martin Fowler, Kent Beck, John Brant, William Opdyke, Don Roberts
books.description: As the application of object technology--particularly the Java programming language--has become commonplace, a new problem has emerged to confront the software development community. Significant numbers of poorly designed programs have been created by less-experienced developers, resulting in applications that are inefficient and hard to maintain and extend.
books.subject: Code Refactoring

books.title: The Pragmatic Programmer: Your Journey to Mastery
books.author: Andrew Hunt, David Thomas
books.description: The Pragmatic Programmer is one of those rare tech books you’ll read, re-read, and read again over the years.
books.subject: Programming Practices

books.title: Code Complete: A Practical Handbook of Software Construction
books.author: Steve McConnell
books.description: Widely considered one of the best practical guides to programming, Steve McConnell’s original CODE COMPLETE has been helping developers write better software for more than a decade.
books.subject: Software Construction

books.title: Working Effectively with Legacy Code
books.author: Michael C. Feathers
books.description: This book provides programmers with the ability to cost-effectively handlecommon legacy code problems without having to go through the hugelyexpensive task of rewriting all existing code.
books.subject: Legacy Code

books.title: The Art of Computer Programming
books.author: Donald E. Knuth
books.description: The bible of all fundamental algorithms and the work that taught many of today’s software developers most of what they know about computer programming.
books.subject: Programming Algorithms

books.title: Introduction to Linear Algebra
books.author: Gilbert Strang
books.description: Linear algebra is something all mathematics undergraduates and many other students, in subjects ranging from engineering to economics, have to learn. The fifth edition of this hugely successful textbook retains all the qualities of earlier editions, while at the same time seeing numerous minor improvements and major additions and revisions.
books.subject: Linear Algebra

books.title: Calculus: Early Transcendentals
books.author: James Stewart
books.description: James Stewart’s CALCULUS: EARLY TRANSCENDENTALS texts are world-wide best-sellers for a reason: they are clear, accurate, and filled with relevant, real-world examples.
books.subject: Calculus

books.title: Probability and Statistics for Engineering and the Sciences
books.author: Jay L. Devore
books.description: Put statistical theories into practice with PROBABILITY AND STATISTICS FOR ENGINEERING AND THE SCIENCES, 9th Edition.
books.subject: Probability and Statistics

books.title: Discrete Mathematics and Its Applications
books.author: Kenneth H. Rosen
books.description: Rosen's Discrete Mathematics and its Applications presents a precise, relevant, comprehensive approach to mathematical concepts.
books.subject: Discrete Mathematics

books.title: Numerical Analysis
books.author: Richard L. Burden, J. Douglas Faires, Annette M. Burden
books.description: This well-respected text introduces the theory and application of modern numerical approximation techniques to students taking a one- or two-semester course in numerical analysis.
books.subject: Numerical Analysis

books.title: Differential Equations and Linear Algebra
books.author: Stephen W. Goode, Scott A. Annin
books.description: Differential Equations and Linear Algebra is designed for use in combined differential equations and linear algebra courses.
books.subject: Differential Equations

books.title: Abstract Algebra
books.author: David S. Dummit, Richard M. Foote
books.description: Widely acclaimed algebra text. This book is designed to give the reader insight into the power and beauty that accrues from a rich interplay between different areas of mathematics.
books.subject: Abstract Algebra

books.title: Complex Analysis
books.author: Theodore W. Gamelin
books.description: The book provides an introduction to complex analysis for students with some familiarity with complex numbers from high school.
books.subject: Complex Analysis

books.title: Real Analysis: Modern Techniques and Their Applications
books.author: Gerald B. Folland
books.description: An in-depth look at real analysis and its applications-now expanded and revised.
books.series: Pure and Applied Mathematics: A Wiley-Interscience Series of Texts, Monographs and Tracts
books.subject: Real Analysis

books.title: Topology
books.author: James R. Munkres
books.description: Topology, Second Edition provides a convenient single text resource for bridging between general and algebraic topology courses.
books.subject: Topology

books.title: Partial Differential Equations: An Introduction
books.author: Walter A. Strauss
books.description: Our understanding of the fundamental processes of the natural world is based to a large extent on partial differential equations (PDEs).
books.subject: Partial Differential Equations

books.title: Number Theory: A Lively Introduction with Proofs, Applications, and Stories
books.author: James Pommersheim, Tim Marks, Erica Flapan
books.description: Number Theory: A Lively Introduction with Proofs, Applications, and Stories, is a new book that provides a rigorous yet accessible introduction to elementary number theory along with relevant applications.
books.subject: Number Theory

books.title: Graph Theory
books.author: Reinhard Diestel
books.description: This standard textbook of modern graph theory, now in its fifth edition, combines the authority of a classic with the engaging freshness of style that is the hallmark of active mathematics.
books.subject: Graph Theory

books.title: Mathematical Statistics with Applications
books.author: Dennis D. Wackerly, William Mendenhall, Richard L. Scheaffer
books.description: In their bestselling MATHEMATICAL STATISTICS WITH APPLICATIONS, premiere authors Dennis Wackerly, William Mendenhall, and Richard L. Scheaffer present a solid foundation in statistical theory while conveying the relevance and importance of the theory in solving practical problems in the real world.
books.subject: Mathematical Statistics

books.title: Electric Circuits
books.author: James W. Nilsson, Susan Riedel
books.description: Electric Circuits, Eleventh Edition, is designed for a one- to -three term course in electric circuits or linear circuit analysis.
books.subject: Electric Circuits

books.title: Fundamentals of Electric Power Engineering
books.author: Isaak D. Mayergoyz, Patrick McAvoy
books.description: Electric power engineering has always been an integral part of electrical engineering education. Providing a unique alternative to existing books on the market, this text presents a concise and rigorous exposition of the main fundamentals of electric power engineering.
books.subject: Power Systems

books.title: Digital Design and Computer Architecture
books.author: David Money Harris, Sarah L. Harris
books.description: Digital Design and Computer Architecture, Third Edition, remains the first choice for anyone who needs to know how modern processors work and how to design a processor.
books.subject: Digital Design

books.title: Signals and Systems
books.author: Alan V. Oppenheim, Alan S. Willsky, with S. Hamid Nawab
books.description: This authoritative book, highly regarded for its intellectual quality and contributions provides a solid foundation and life-long reference for anyone studying the most important methods of modern signal and system analysis.
books.subject: Signals and Systems

books.title: Microelectronic Circuits
books.author: Adel S. Sedra, Kenneth C. Smith
books.description: Microelectronic Circuits by Sedra and Smith has served generations of electrical and computer engineering students as the best and most widely-used text for this required course.
books.series: The Oxford Series in Electrical and Computer Engineering
books.subject: Microelectronics

books.title: Electromagnetic Field Theory Fundamentals
books.author: Bhag Singh Guru, Hüseyin R. Hiziroglu
books.description: Guru and Hiziroglu have produced an accessible and user-friendly text on electromagnetics that will appeal to both students and professors teaching this course.
books.subject: Electromagnetic Theory

books.title: Control Systems Engineering
books.author: Norman S. Nise
books.description: Highly regarded for its accessibility and focus on practical applications, Control Systems Engineering offers students a comprehensive introduction to the design and analysis of feedback systems that support modern technology.
books.subject: Control Systems

books.title: Communication Systems
books.author: Simon Haykin, Michael Moher
books.description: This best-selling communication systems text continues to include the most comprehensive and rigorous coverage of digital communications in an undergraduate level text in this Fifth Edition.
books.subject: Communication Systems

books.title: Power Electronics: Converters, Applications, and Design
books.author: Ned Mohan, Tore M. Undeland, William P. Robbins
books.description: Offering step-by-step, in-depth coverage, the new Third Edition of Power Electronics: Converters, Applications, and Design provides a cohesive presentation of power electronics fundamentals for applications and design in the power range of 500 kW or less.
books.subject: Power Electronics

books.title: Antenna Theory: Analysis and Design
books.author: Constantine A. Balanis
books.description: Updated with color and gray scale illustrations, a companion website housing supplementary material, and new sections covering recent developments in antenna analysis and design.
books.subject: Antenna Theory
